page.title: 12Margam Park. Kitchen Garden
page.content: The site of the former village of Margam demolished in the 1840's and latterly a Kitchen Garden. It now forms part of the formal gardens. Recent excavations revealed the drains and part of the Guest House of the former Abbey and the forecourt of the Village Inn. Here are the vine and propagating house, Pinetum and Garden Museum. A maze covering one acre and containg 3,250 conifers was completed in the winter of 1982 but the trees are of insufficient height for it to be opened to the public. An amphitheatre for open air concerts has also been constructed.
